comment: Professor Rendini gives great feedback on assignments and has a clear grading criteria. Be sure to meet assignment deadlines because she does not accept late work. She also lets you work ahead.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Prof. Rendini is very hands-off. I don't think I emailed her a single time with a question. Her instructions are very clear and straightforward. She uses Bearface, which is pretty simple and accessible. There is a good bit of reading and writing, but overall this is an easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I enjoyed this professor, i would say that there are many assignments but if you complete them you are perfectly fine! I loved this class, be ready to watch a lot of videos!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Such a sweet professor! Easy work and easy A! Always available to reach out via email. She helps you in any way she possibly can throughout the course.

Mrs. Rendini is absolutely amazing! She grades really easy & she's really dedicated to her classes and provides a lot of useful information that would be extremely important for us to use in our future teaching careers. She is willing to work with you on anything & answers emails with details & fast. Take her if you can!

Professor Rendini was very sweet. Her grading was very clear and the modules were organized and easy to follow. I liked how she went ahead and opened up every module so we could work ahead if we wanted to. She was very responsive to emails and was always willing to help us out if we needed it. I would highly recommend taking her for HPE 3670.

She was a very nice lady, if you miss class ur grade willl be affected. She ACCEPTS NO LATE WORK OR EXCUSES!! If you miss an assignment by 5 mins she will not let you try it or do it for half credit. Other than that very nice woman
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: amazing professor. took 8am hybrid class n even tho it was super early it wasn't too bad. I missed some readings but she does offer extra credit GO TO CLASS. those extra 8/9 pts for participation helped me get from a B to an A without extra credit. loved her class, she really tries to connect with students. very understanding.

Professor Rendini was so awesome! She was flexible on some due dates which was really nice- all we had to do was ask for an extension. She's super caring and gives lots of positive feedback. There are a TON of discussion board posts to do every week, but they're super easy. If you don't do assignments on time, you can't submit after the due date.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: The only negative is this course is online, I personally would have preferred it to be face to face. I love Professor Rendini. The course work isnt too difficult but you do have assignments where you will video yourself teaching lessons. Overall I enjoyed this class and learned a lot about PE and Health and how to incorporate it into my classroom.

I didn't take the class very seriously and it cost me my A, just stay on top of assignments and it's so simple and easy. She also made us do active stuff everyday so be ready to exercise when you have her.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took her online class, which was fine. We completed a bunch of modules on Bearface and wrote a lot of short blurbs about wellness. I feel like the class itself was pretty much a waste of my time but through no fault of the professor.

I'd take someone easier for WELL 1000. Very strict on attendance- can't miss even one class without losing points. The midterm was tough and my whole class did poorly- she wouldn't curve it at all. Luckily, the online modules and extra credit weigh a lot in her grading scale. Book chapters are super long with tons of info- hard to study. She's ok.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: One of the sweetest professors I know. The only hard thing about this class are the midterm and final but practically everything is a completion grade. There is extra credit available too in forms of 5k's or gym classes. Easiest A I have ever made. Maybe requires 20 minutes of outside work every two weeks.

Super bubbly, energetic, and sweet. I was hospitalized throughout the semester & she worked with me. I took her hybrid. There were 6 Modules, usually do 2 weeks apart on a Sunday night. Turn them in on time and make sure your Healthy Living Check-Ins follow the rubric exactly. Easy A and she made the class fun for an 8am.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: The class wasn't hard if you show up and at least pretend to be interested in the in-class activities. She counts for each day you attend and the online activities (if you take the hybrid class) are easy.

Professor Rendini is amazing!! I took her hybrid class. We only met one time each week. You will be required to work out each time you go to class so make sure to wear work out clothes! The exercises are easy. As long as you put in effort, you will get credit. The modules are very easy. If you don't do the modules, you will probably fail.

Wellness is an awful class to begin with, however Ms. Rendini makes it fun! She makes you participate in little fitness activities  in class but also goes over material pertaining to wellness as well. She's very nice and wants to help. The only con is she uses Bearface which requires a ton of writing :(

I took her at 8 am, and she has high energy, so don't do that. Other than that, the class is super easy, just keep up with times and dates. In class, she has some more extreme ways she gets things done. She can be very talkative or make you do odd physical activities but not a bad class.
Take her hybrid course PERIOD. She is a great prof. Very helpful and clear on what she wants. Get to know her (I fainted in her class, I don't think she'll ever forget me). She is awesome!!
I took a hybrid of this class. It wasn't difficult. If you attend class and don't forget to turn in work you'll get an A.
hybrid class. Mr Rendini is really patient and helpful. she always help you to catch up test or anything else if she see that you really are interested in the class. She is great
great class and a great professor

Rendini is a nice lady. She's willing to help with any questions you have if you just ask. She's very hyper and it's kinda annoying. 3 major tests; STUDY STUDY STUDY. The final is optional. The last test is the hardest. YOU NEED THE BOOK TO PASS THE CLASS.
This teacher is an abomination. She does'nt give you any insight on what is coming up. When things are due until the day after and she rarely gives any grade higher than a 50. Good Luck.

Professor Rendini's class is extremely easy!I found it to be pointless, considering I already knew most of the information she covered in class.Her tests were VERY easy!I hardly studied, and if I did I read her power points online.The Pedometer project however was annoying. She doesn't really communicate very well at all.Talk to her in person!
She gives pointless lectures, and the syallbus and class discussions rarely include dierections on due dates and assignments. Very nice lady though. Class is EXTREMELY POINTLESS!

She is a very nice lady! Class seems pointless but go to class because every time you miss, you get 5 points taken off you participation grade. Kind of a lot of work for the level of difficulty of the class, but I made an A.

A ridiculous amount of work for a class that should be an easy A. This teacher WILL knock off 5 points off your attendance grade every time you miss class, which is ridiculous because the activities are silly and the lectures are even more pointless. The tests are tricky too so be sure to read the $99 required and impossible to navigate e-book.

This teacher is about as knowledgable as a middle school PE teacher. She repeats herself all the time, and has a REALLY annoying voice. SHE WILL NEVER EMAIL YOU BACK, so don't count on it. I honestly don't think either her or Howton check it at all. AND they don't remind you of important dates in the syllabus, so check it. This class was annoying.

Took this class along with Howton. Rendini was a very nice lady and tried to make everything understandable. Was much more lenient and understanding than Howton. Things in this class were very unclear, test questions were unexpected and nothing important was covered in class. Activity days are mandatory, lots of them so get ready.
Be prepared to run 2 to 3 miles per day.

Too many goofy activities which require mandatory attendance. Tests are mult choice but VERY tricky. Makes a simple class way too busy and way too time consuming. Book is HORRIBLE yet required. All HPS 1000 classes should be online.

Yes,Shes an extremely nice, energetic teacher.Her class is alot of difficult work though.The hardest was the online quizzes which were a BIG chunk of the grade,which brought my grade down,so be careful!They were nearly impossible.Tests pretty hard too.Lots of annoying groupwork activites. Hated the class. Nice prof though. Medium to hard class.

The class isn't as easy as I thought it would be and you actually have to study for the tests, but she puts all the notes on Vista. You have to attend the activity days, too. Professor is extremely nice and energetic!
I thought she was a great teacher for the 10 weeks that we had class. She is definitely an activity person, so be prepared to do lots of activities in her class!

What can I say? This is the plain and simple college version of PE. In other words, an easy A. I have only had one other class this easy(Art Appreciation). Participate and get an A. Rendini is as helpful as can be without actually doing work for you.

Professor is very fun and energetic! Activities are fun and interesting... You can easily make an A. Test aren't hard but do require a good bit of studying to make a decent grade. Material is easy to learn and enlightening.

The P.E. portion of this class was fun.  We learned a lot of P.E. type activities that you can integrate into the core curriculum.  Ms. Rendini is really nice and very fair.  You'll get your exercise, just have fun with it!

She is a very nice lady and this class is pretty easy. All tests are very easy with a little bit of studying and class is pretty interesting. It can seem pointless at times because alot is common sense but it can be helpful. All work done outside of class was a breeze. You can tell she loves teaching this subject and she has high energy everyday.
Was one point away from an A. Wouldn't give it even when she stated it in class that she would do roll-over points. Been to every class. Thanks for ruining my chance to get a scholarship this year.
Drops one of the four tests so if you do well on the first three tests you don't have to take the final. Easy to get an A in this class. Lectures are not that interesting.

Okay class. She doesn't give you time to copy notes, and puts the notes on webct, but they don't cover all the test questions. She will test you on just casual things she mentions in class. I had a 4.0 before taking this class, my very first B. I thought I was studing enough, but apparently not.
Very nice. Very helpful. There is an attendance policy. Notes given b4 test are exactly what will be on the test. Final is optional.
No Comments
Excellent teacher, wonderful person. Really cares about health of students.
She is fairly easy, if you just show up to class and pay attention, and do some of the work you should pass.
She is not too hard if you study the notes and the information in the book. Her test are not the easiest but if you do the work and turn it in on time, you should make an A or easy B.
She is a very nice teacher, and I would recommend taking her.  But make sure you do all the work and you will recieve an "A" easily!

She is a really nice person and will help you out here and there. Just make sure you turn in your homework/labs/quizes in on time. The tests are not the easiest though. They are very in depth and the study guides only help out a little bit.
Turn in homework and study for the tests and you'll make an easy  A .
